title: Plugin Architecture for Sonar Catalog
description:
## Overview

Introduce a pluggable extension system for sonar-catalog, inspired by napari's plugin architecture (entry_points discovery, hook specifications, plugin manifests, registry with enable/disable).

### Motivation

Sonar-catalog currently supports JSF and XTF formats via hardcoded extractors in sonar_catalog/extractors/. As the tool grows, third parties need to add:
- New sonar format parsers (s7k, ALL, KMALL, Humminbird, Lowrance, etc.)
- New nav extractors (from proprietary binary formats)
- Custom metadata extractors
- Export formats (GeoJSON, KML, shapefiles)
- Web UI dashboard widgets

### Key Patterns from Napari to Adopt

1. Entry-point discovery - plugins register via [project.entry-points."sonar_catalog.plugins"] in their pyproject.toml
2. Plugin manifest - lightweight YAML declaring capabilities (formats, extractors, UI contributions)
3. Hook specifications - formal extension points with firstresult (format detection) and historic (accumulate all) semantics
4. Plugin registry - singleton manager with enable/disable, event emission, settings persistence
5. Resource validation - validate plugin contributions at registration time

### Extension Points Identified

- Format detection (magic bytes) - firstresult - Currently in crawler.py:SONAR_SIGNATURES
- Nav extraction - firstresult - Currently in extractors/__init__.py:_FORMAT_EXTRACTORS
- Metadata extraction - historic - Not yet implemented
- Export formats - firstresult - Not yet implemented
- Web UI pages/widgets - historic - web/views.py hardcoded routes

### Implementation Phases

1. Core plugin infrastructure - PluginManager, hook specs, entry_point discovery
2. Migrate existing code - Move JSF/XTF extractors + SONAR_SIGNATURES to built-in plugin
3. Config integration - Plugin enable/disable in config.json, settings persistence
4. Developer experience - Plugin template/cookiecutter, docs, example plugin

title: Core plugin manager and hook specification system
description:
Create the foundational plugin infrastructure inspired by napari's PluginManager pattern.

## Files to Create

### sonar_catalog/plugins/__init__.py
- Global PluginManager singleton
- initialize_plugins() function (called once at startup)
- Discovers plugins via Python entry_points group: sonar_catalog.plugins

### sonar_catalog/plugins/manager.py
- PluginManager class with:
  - register(plugin_name, module) - register a plugin
  - unregister(plugin_name) - clean up and remove
  - enable(plugin_name) / disable(plugin_name)
  - discover() - scan entry_points and load manifests
  - Internal dicts tracking registered: format_detectors, nav_extractors, exporters, web_widgets
  - Event callbacks: on_register, on_unregister, on_enable, on_disable

### sonar_catalog/plugins/hooks.py
- Hook specification decorators and definitions
- HookSpec class with firstresult and historic modes
- Defined hooks:
  - detect_format(file_path, first_bytes) -> str|None [firstresult]
  - extract_nav(file_path, sonar_format) -> NavResult|None [firstresult]
  - get_format_signatures() -> dict [historic, accumulate all magic bytes]
  - get_extension_map() -> dict [historic, accumulate all ext mappings]
  - register_api_routes(blueprint) -> None [historic, for web plugins]

### sonar_catalog/plugins/manifest.py
- PluginManifest dataclass (parsed from plugin's sonar-plugin.yaml or entry_point metadata)
- Fields: name, version, description, author, supported_formats, contributions
- Validation on load

## Key Design Decisions
- Use importlib.metadata.entry_points() for discovery (stdlib, no deps)
- Keep it simple - no pluggy dependency, just a clean registry pattern
- Built-in plugins register the same way as third-party ones
- Hooks are just callable registrations with ordering support

## Acceptance Criteria
- PluginManager can discover, register, enable/disable plugins
- Hook specs define clear extension contracts
- Unit tests for manager lifecycle
close_reason: Implemented. 41 tests passing. Created plugins/ package with hooks.py, manager.py, __init__.py

title: Create built-in plugin from existing extractors and format detection
description:
Migrate all existing hardcoded format detection and nav extraction into a built-in plugin that registers through the same hook system as third-party plugins.

## What Moves

### From crawler.py -> sonar_catalog/plugins/builtin/
- SONAR_SIGNATURES dict -> register via get_format_signatures() hook
- EXTENSION_TO_FORMAT dict -> register via get_extension_map() hook
- detect_sonar_format() logic stays in crawler but calls plugin hooks

### From extractors/ -> sonar_catalog/plugins/builtin/
- JSFExtractor -> builtin plugin's extract_nav hook impl
- XTFExtractor -> builtin plugin's extract_nav hook impl
- SidecarExtractor -> remains as core (not plugin), since it's config-driven
- NavResult, NavExtractor ABC -> stay in extractors/base.py as the contract

## Files to Create

### sonar_catalog/plugins/builtin/__init__.py
- register_builtin() function called by PluginManager.discover()
- Registers all built-in hooks

### sonar_catalog/plugins/builtin/formats.py
- Implements get_format_signatures() hook -> returns SONAR_SIGNATURES
- Implements get_extension_map() hook -> returns EXTENSION_TO_FORMAT
- Implements detect_format() hook for magic-byte matching

### sonar_catalog/plugins/builtin/nav.py
- Implements extract_nav() hook
- Wraps JSFExtractor and XTFExtractor
- Returns NavResult from first successful extractor

## Files to Modify

### crawler.py
- Remove SONAR_SIGNATURES and EXTENSION_TO_FORMAT hardcoded dicts
- detect_sonar_format() calls PluginManager hooks instead
- Keep custom_magic_bytes config support (merged with plugin-provided signatures)

### extractors/__init__.py
- Remove _FORMAT_EXTRACTORS hardcoded list
- extract_nav() dispatcher calls PluginManager hook instead
- Sidecar still runs first (config-driven, not a plugin)

## Acceptance Criteria
- All 85 existing tests still pass
- Format detection works identically via plugin hooks
- Nav extraction works identically via plugin hooks
- No behavior change for end users
close_reason: Migrated format detection and nav extraction to builtin plugin. SONAR_SIGNATURES/EXTENSION_TO_FORMAT moved from crawler.py to plugins/builtin/formats.py. JSF/XTF extractors wrapped in plugins/builtin/nav.py. Both crawler and extractors dispatch through plugin hooks with fallback. All 126 tests pass.

title: Plugin enable/disable config and CLI management
description:
Add configuration and CLI commands for managing plugins (enable, disable, list, info).

## Config Changes (config.py)

### New PluginConfig dataclass
- enabled_plugins: list[str] = [] (empty = all enabled)
- disabled_plugins: list[str] = []
- plugin_settings: dict[str, dict] = {} (per-plugin config)

### Add to Config
- plugins: PluginConfig field

## CLI Commands (cli.py)

### sonar-catalog plugins list
- Show all discovered plugins with status (enabled/disabled/error)
- Show each plugin's contributions (formats, extractors, etc.)

### sonar-catalog plugins enable <name>
- Remove from disabled_plugins, save config

### sonar-catalog plugins disable <name>
- Add to disabled_plugins, save config
- Warn if disabling built-in plugin

### sonar-catalog plugins info <name>
- Show plugin manifest details, version, author
- List all hooks it implements

## Settings Persistence
- Plugin enable/disable state saved to config.json
- Loaded at startup in initialize_plugins()
- PluginManager respects disabled_plugins list during discover()

## Acceptance Criteria
- Plugins can be enabled/disabled via CLI and config
- Disabled plugins are not loaded
- Plugin list shows accurate state
- Config round-trips correctly
close_reason: Added PluginConfig to config.py, plugins CLI subcommand (list/enable/disable/info), fixed list-magic-bytes import, initialized plugin system in CLI main(). 137 tests pass.

title: Entry-point based plugin discovery and manifest loading
description:
Implement Python entry_points-based plugin discovery so third-party packages can register as sonar-catalog plugins.

## How It Works

Third-party plugins declare themselves in pyproject.toml:

    [project.entry-points."sonar_catalog.plugins"]
    my_sonar_plugin = "my_package:plugin_module"

The entry point target module must have either:
1. A register(manager) function that registers hooks directly, OR
2. A sonar-plugin.yaml manifest file in the package declaring contributions

## PluginManager.discover() Implementation

1. Call importlib.metadata.entry_points(group="sonar_catalog.plugins")
2. For each entry point:
   a. Skip if in disabled_plugins config
   b. Load the module
   c. Look for register() function -> call it with manager
   d. OR look for sonar-plugin.yaml in package -> parse manifest -> auto-register
   e. Track in _registered_plugins dict
   f. Emit on_register callback
3. Always register builtin plugin first (lowest priority)

## Manifest Format (sonar-plugin.yaml)

    name: my-sonar-plugin
    version: 1.0.0
    description: Adds support for FooBar sonar format
    
    contributions:
      formats:
        - name: foobar
          extensions: [".fb", ".fbar"]
          magic_bytes: "464f4f42"  # hex
          magic_offset: 0
      
      nav_extractors:
        - format: foobar
          python_name: my_package.extractors:FooBarExtractor

## Acceptance Criteria
- Plugins discovered from entry_points at startup
- Both register() and manifest-based registration work
- Built-in plugin uses same mechanism
- Error handling: bad plugins logged + skipped, don't crash
close_reason: Entry-point discovery and YAML manifest loading implemented. Added manifest.py with PluginManifest dataclass, load_manifest(), register_from_manifest(), and _import_object(). Manager.discover() now falls back to manifest loading when no register() function found. 52 plugin tests, 137 total.

title: Export format plugin hooks (GeoJSON, KML, shapefile)
description:
Add an export extension point so plugins can contribute new export formats for catalog data.

## Hook Specification

### export_data(data, format_name, output_path) -> bool [firstresult]
- Called when user runs: sonar-catalog export --format geojson -o output.geojson
- Plugin returns True if it handled the export

### get_export_formats() -> list[dict] [historic]
- Returns list of supported export formats with metadata
- Each dict: {name, description, file_extension, supports_nav}

## Built-in Export Formats
- CSV (already exists implicitly in stats/search output)
- JSON (catalog dump)

## Plugin-Provided Examples (future, not in this issue)
- GeoJSON (nav tracks as FeatureCollection)
- KML (for Google Earth)
- Shapefile (for GIS tools)

## CLI Integration
- sonar-catalog export --format <name> [--bbox lat_min,lat_max,lon_min,lon_max] -o <path>
- sonar-catalog export --list-formats (shows all registered formats)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Export hook specs defined
- Built-in CSV/JSON exporters registered
- CLI export command works
- Third-party plugins can add formats via entry_points
close_reason: Implemented and tested. 396 tests passing, 80% coverage.

title: Web UI plugin contribution system
description:
Allow plugins to contribute web UI pages and dashboard widgets, similar to napari's dock widget registration.

## Hook Specification

### register_web_routes(blueprint) -> None [historic]
- Called during create_app() setup
- Plugin receives a Flask Blueprint to register routes on
- Routes namespaced under /plugins/<plugin_name>/

### get_dashboard_widgets() -> list[dict] [historic]
- Returns widget definitions for the main dashboard
- Each dict: {name, template_fragment, js_url, css_url, position}

## Implementation

### web/__init__.py (create_app)
- After registering core blueprints, call PluginManager to get web contributions
- Register plugin blueprints with url_prefix=/plugins/<name>

### web/templates/base.html
- Add plugin widget injection points in the nav and dashboard

## Security Considerations
- Plugin routes are sandboxed under /plugins/ prefix
- Static files served from plugin's own static folder
- No access to core template context

## Acceptance Criteria
- Plugins can register Flask routes
- Plugin pages accessible at /plugins/<name>/
- Plugin static files served correctly
- Core UI not affected if no plugins installed
close_reason: Implemented and tested. 396 tests passing, 80% coverage.

title: Plugin developer experience: template, docs, example plugin
description:
Create tooling and documentation to make it easy for third parties to write sonar-catalog plugins.

## Deliverables

### Example Plugin Package
Create examples/sonar-catalog-plugin-example/ with:
- pyproject.toml with entry_points
- sonar-plugin.yaml manifest
- Simple format detector + nav extractor for a mock format
- Tests showing how to test a plugin in isolation
- README explaining the plugin structure

### Plugin Developer Guide
- How plugins are discovered (entry_points)
- Available hook specs with signatures and examples
- How to test plugins
- How to publish to PyPI

### CLI: sonar-catalog plugins create <name>
- Interactive scaffolding (like cookiecutter)
- Generates pyproject.toml, manifest, boilerplate extractor
- Creates test file with fixtures

## Acceptance Criteria
- Example plugin installable with pip install -e examples/sonar-catalog-plugin-example
- Example plugin shows up in sonar-catalog plugins list
- Developer guide covers all extension points
- Scaffold command generates working plugin skeleton
close_reason: Deferred â€” core plugin system fully working with discover/register/hooks. DX tooling can be added later.

title: Add LICENSE file (MIT) to project root
description: PyPI requires a LICENSE file. pyproject.toml declares MIT but no LICENSE file exists at the repo root. Add the standard MIT license text.

title: Publish sonar-catalog on PyPI
description: Get the sonar-catalog package ready for public release on PyPI. Covers licensing, metadata, build verification, CI/CD publishing workflow, and the actual first release.

title: Test publish to TestPyPI
description: Do a dry-run publish to TestPyPI to verify the full upload flow works (metadata renders correctly, package installs from TestPyPI). Fix any issues before the real publish.

title: Add project.urls and authors to pyproject.toml
description: Add project.urls (Homepage, Repository, Documentation, Bug Tracker) and authors field to pyproject.toml. These show on the PyPI project page and help users find the repo/docs.

title: Add GitHub Actions workflow for PyPI publishing
description: Add a CI workflow that builds and publishes to PyPI on tagged releases. Use trusted publishing (OIDC) with PyPI. Trigger on push of v* tags. Include a test step before publish.

title: Verify package builds cleanly with sdist and wheel
description: Run 'python -m build' and verify both sdist and wheel are produced without errors. Check that setuptools-scm resolves the version from the v0.1.0 tag. Inspect wheel contents to ensure all expected files are included (templates, static assets, etc.).

title: Tag v0.2.0 and publish to PyPI
description: Once everything is verified, create the v0.2.0 tag and push it to trigger the publish workflow (or manually upload with twine). Verify the package appears on PyPI and is installable with pip install sonar-catalog.

title: Dev/sim mode with synthetic data generation
description: Add a dev/sim mode that generates realistic synthetic sonar catalog data (files, locations, nav tracks) so developers can explore the UI and API without real sonar data. Includes: CLI command 'sonar-catalog demo', synthetic data generator, coverage boost for search/cli/crawler paths.
close_reason: Implemented and tested. 396 tests passing, 80% coverage.
